Nerangs.ab: abarhāwan čīyōn xwaršēd gardēd andar hāwan sē bār gardēnīdan ud hōm ud urwarām pad abarhāwan stānišn haomanąmca harəš́iiamnanąm ... hunuuaitiiā̊ aṣ̌aiia fraš́ūtaiiā̊ fraš́āuuaiiamnaiiā̊ pad aršuxδanąmca vacaŋhąm srešk-ē andar ǰīwdān abganišn srauuaŋhąmca zaraϑuštrinąm ... vaxəδβanąmca varštuuanąmca pad aϑa.zī nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən hōm ud urwarām pad abarhāwan az dast ī hōy be barsom barišn humaiia aēta ... īžiiāca cinaϑāmaide ... haδa.ratufrītinąm pad aϑa.zī.nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən abarhāwan abāg hōm ud urwarām pad kustag ī hōy pad sar ī barsom abāz nihišn

"He has to turn turn three times the pestle around over the mortar in the direction in which the sun rotates and to take hōm and urwarām with the abarhāwan. haomanąmca harəš́iiamnanąm ... hunuuaitiiā̊ aṣ̌aiia fraš́ūtaiiā̊ fraš́āuuaiiamnaiiā̊. At aršuxδanąmca vacaŋhąm, he has to pour one drop (of hōm and urwarām) into the ǰīwdān (and continue with) srauuaŋhąmca zaraϑuštrinąm ... vaxəδβanąmca varštuuanąmca. At aϑa.zī.nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən, he has to bring the hōm and urwarām with the abarhāwan from the left hand to the barsom (and continue with) humaiia aēta ... īžiiāca cinaϑāmaide. At aϑa.zī.nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən, he has to touch with the abarhāwan that has the hōm and the urwarām the end of the barsom from the left side."

haomanąmca harəš́iiamnanąm ... hə̄ca iδa yōiϑβā astu ēn gyāg abarhāwan pēš ī dastag hōm ī kōftag stadan humaiia upaŋhā̊ cīṣ̌maide ahunahe vairiiehe aṣ̌aiia frasrūtahe frasrāuuaiiamnahe hāuuanaiiā̊sca ēn gyāg hāwandastag pad hōm harw dō pad bun ī hāwan hunīdan haomą hunuuaiṇtiiā̊ frašutaiiā̊ frašāuuaiiamnaiiā̊ ... vaxəδβanąmca varštuuanąmca aϑa.zī nə̄ ēn gyāg abarhāwan dastag hōm abāg ǰām ī jiąm ēk ud srešk-ē andar jiąm abganišn humāiiōtara aŋhən pad ēn wāzag humāiiōtara aŋhən ... aϑa.zī.nə̄ ēn gyāg hāwandastag ud hōm abāg pad war ī zōhrag barišn bar-ā-bar ī barsom dārišn humāiiōtaraca īžiiōtaraca humāiiōtara aŋhən ... aϑa.zī.nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən ēn gyāg hāwandastag bun pad pādyāb kardan pad dast ī hōy griftan ud rāspīg guftan kū humāiiō.tara aŋhən ...

"haomanąmca harəš́iiamnanąm ... hə̄ca iδa yōiϑβā astu At this passage, he should to grab the abarhāwan and the striken hōm by the handgrip (and continue with) humaiia upaŋhā̊ cīšmaide ahunahe vairiiehe aṣ̌aiia frasrūtahe frasrāuuaiiamnahe hāuuanaiiā̊sca. At this passage, he shuold pound the hāwandastag together with the hōm against the bottom of the hāwan. haomą hunuuaiṇtiiā̊ frašutaiiā̊ frašāuuaiiamnaiiā̊ ... vaxəδβanąmca. varštuuanąmca. aϑa.zī. nə̄. At this passage, he has to join the handgrip of the abarhāwan and the hōm with the container of the ǰīw and pour one drop into the ǰīwām with these words: humāiiōtara. aŋhən ... aϑa.zī.nə̄. At this passage, he has to bring the hāwandastag and the hōm towards the zōhrag and hold it at the level with the barsom. humāiiōtaraca īžiiōtaraca humāiiōtara ... aϑa.zī.nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən. At this passage, he has to clean the end of the hāwandastag with pādyāb, he should take it with the left hand and the rāspīg should say: humāiiō.tara aŋhən."

Quotations.ab: pad haomanąmca harəš́iiamnanąm abarhāwan abāz gardēnišn pad aršuxδanąmca vacaŋhąm ēw srešk andar ō jīuu abganišn pad aϑa.zī nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən be war ī zōhrag barišn ud pad barsom dārišn

"At haomanąmca harəš́iiamnanąm, he has to turn the abarhāwan around. At aršuxδanąmca vacaŋhąm, he has to pour a drop (of the hōm and urwarām) into the ǰīw. At aϑa.zī nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən, he has to bring them (the hōm and urwarām) towards the zōhrag and to hold them over the zōhrag."
Cf. N28.47c Kotwal and Kreyenbroek, 2003 p. 107:
pad haomanąmca harəšiiamnanąm abar hāwan abāz gardēnišn
At haomanąmca harəšiiamnanąm he has to turn the pestle around over the mortar cf.
